intro: Meibomia adscendens var. obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often climbing stems and opposite, ovate to obovate leaves. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are typically arranged in clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits. Meibomia adscendens var. obovata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
